body_html:
This sounds like either an error with the JDK installation on the machine or an issue with bazel. The rule that is complaining is:

external/bazel_tools/tools/jdk/BUILD:193:17: in singlejar attribute of java_toolchain rule @bazel_tools//tools/jdk:toolchain: '@bazel_tools//tools/jdk:singlejar' must produce a single file

which isn't specific to TensorFlow, it's where bazel finds the JDK. This seems similar to bazelbuild/bazel#3988 .

Could you try https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/tutorial/java.html to validate that the bazel and JDK configuration on your machine is fine? It should be something as simple as this:

git clone https://github.com/bazelbuild/examples/
cd examples/java-tutorial
bazel build //:ProjectRunner

body:
This sounds like either an error with the JDK installation on the machine or an issue with bazel. The rule that is complaining is:

```
external/bazel_tools/tools/jdk/BUILD:193:17: in singlejar attribute of java_toolchain rule @bazel_tools//tools/jdk:toolchain: '@bazel_tools//tools/jdk:singlejar' must produce a single file
```

which isn't specific to TensorFlow, it's where bazel finds the JDK. This seems similar to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/3988 .

Could you try https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/tutorial/java.html to validate that the bazel and JDK configuration on your machine is fine? It should be something as simple as this:

```sh
git clone https://github.com/bazelbuild/examples/
cd examples/java-tutorial
bazel build //:ProjectRunner
```
